H0.text: They all hold liquids, the common feature of a cylinder, a measuring cup, and a beaker.

H1.text: They can all be made of glass is the most important thing that a cylinder, a measuring cup, and a beaker all have in common.

H2.text: They can all be marked in milliliters, which is the most important feature shared by a cylinder, a measuring cup, and a beaker.

H3.text: They can all be used to measure the volume of a liquid, which is the most important thing a cylinder, a measuring cup, and a beaker all have in common.

A4.text: These marks are not intended for obtaining a precise measurement of volume

A5.text: Beakers are available in a wide range of sizes, from one milliliter up to several liters
